# Safety Deposit Box System
The [color=#44cc00]Safety Deposit Box System[/color] allows you to securely store items across shifts in a persistent database. Your stored items will remain available even after the round ends or the server restarts.
## Safety Deposit Console
The [color=#44cc00]Safety Deposit Console[/color] is your interface for managing your deposit boxes. Located at Frontier Outpost and Tinnia's Rest, it allows you to: - [bold]Purchase[/bold] new safety deposit boxes - [bold]Deposit[/bold] boxes to store items in the database - [bold]Withdraw[/bold] stored boxes to retrieve your items - [bold]Reclaim[/bold] lost boxes that were never returned
## Box Sizes and Pricing
Three box sizes are available, each with different storage capacity: - [bold]Small (2x2)[/bold] - $2,250,000 Spesos - [bold]Medium (2x4)[/bold] - $3,500,000 Spesos - [bold]Large (2x6)[/bold] - $4,250,000 Spesos
The cost is deducted from your [color=#44cc00]bank account[/color] when you purchase a box.
## How to Use
### Purchasing a Box 1. Access a [color=#44cc00]Safety Deposit Console[/color] 2. Select the size you want (Small, Medium, or Large) 3. The cost will be deducted from your bank account 4. A physical box will spawn for you to use
### Storing Items 1. Place items inside your safety deposit box 2. Insert the box into the console's [color=#33bbff]box slot[/color] 3. Click the [bold]Deposit Box[/bold] button 4. Your items are now safely stored in the database!
The physical box will be consumed when deposited, but your items are now protected across shifts.
### Retrieving Items 1. Access a [color=#44cc00]Safety Deposit Console[/color] 2. Find your box in the list (boxes show as [color=#00ff00]"Stored"[/color] when they have items) 3. Click the [bold]Withdraw[/bold] button 4. A physical box containing your items will spawn
[color=#ff6600]Important:[/color] Once withdrawn, the box and items exist in the world. If you lose the box or it's destroyed before re-depositing, your items are gone!
## Box Status Indicators
Your boxes can have several status indicators: - [color=#00ff00][bold]Stored[/bold][/color] - Box has items safely stored in the database - [color=#ffff00][bold]In World[/bold][/color] - Box was withdrawn recently (less than 7 days ago) - [color=#ff0000][bold]Lost (Empty)[/bold][/color] - Box was withdrawn over 7 days ago and never returned
## Reclaiming Lost Boxes
If you lost a box after withdrawing it (disconnected, round ended, etc.), and it shows as [color=#ff0000]"Lost (Empty)"[/color]: 1. Access a [color=#44cc00]Safety Deposit Console[/color] 2. Find the lost box in your list 3. Click the [bold]Reclaim[/bold] button 4. A new empty box with the same ID will be issued to you
[color=#ff6600]Note:[/color] Reclaiming removes the old database record. Any items that were in the box when it was lost are gone permanently.
## Tips and Best Practices
- [bold]Label your boxes[/bold] - Use a hand labeler to give your boxes nicknames for easy identification - [bold]Deposit before leaving[/bold] - Always re-deposit your boxes before ending your shift - [bold]Keep valuables safe[/bold] - Store important documents, rare items, or valuable equipment - [bold]Multiple boxes[/bold] - You can own multiple boxes to organize different types of items - [bold]ID cards can't be stored[/bold] - The system won't allow ID cards to be deposited for security reasons
## Item Preservation
The safety deposit system preserves: - [bold]Paper content[/bold] - Written documents, stamps, and signatures - [bold]Labels[/bold] - Custom names you've applied to items - [bold]Stack counts[/bold] - The exact number of items in stacks - [bold]Box nicknames[/bold] - Custom labels on the boxes themselves
Most items can be stored, but some sensitive items (like ID cards) are blacklisted for security reasons.
